data.title: Uncaught ReferenceError: CommandInstaller is not defined
data.body:
Reproduced on OS X 10.9.5 with Atom v0.136.0-d7efa9b:
## Repro Steps
1. Launch Atom
2. Pull down the Atom menu and select `Install Shell Commands`

**Expected:** Atom shell commands get installed
**Actual:** Receive following error:

```
Uncaught ReferenceError: CommandInstaller is not defined 
            /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/workspace.js:158
```
## Notes

It appears that the appropriate require was in the file in this commit:

https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/19ff2bd9862dbdb50ed426adef076dc889b3d044/src/workspace.coffee

But it is not in the next commit that affects that file:

https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/99a14c07f5241b83a07958282632324686abb60a/src/workspace.coffee

But the change doesn't show up in the diff ...

https://github.com/atom/atom/commit/99a14c07f5241b83a07958282632324686abb60a#diff-88caa33888e5345667751ee7182b4c36

data.title: German Keyboard Bug!! Serious Problem!!!
data.body:
German Keyboard... CANT do "\"
wanted to do a "\n" but when i type "\" the code shrinks!!

eg. in xml... when i type "\" the code shrinks to the next parent node and a clickable orange triangle appears.

wtf?? I CANT TYPE "\n"

data.title: Golang highlighting breaks for long lines
data.body:
After many consecutive ORs in Golang, the code highlighting is messed up till the end of the file.

![Example](http://i.dondaniello.com/2014-10-05_18-18-17_aMej.png)

Code is obviously valid and compiles correctly.

data.title: Atom has no easy to use Ctrl scroll wheel to zoom the editor window
data.body:
The title describes the issue pretty well but here are some details

When I pressed Ctrl and turned the scroll whell, I was expecting it to zoom the fonts in the editor like ST does. 
But nothing happened. 

I am using atom 0.135.0 in ubuntu 14.04 64bits.

data.title: Atom adds new line on save.
data.body:
Hi.
When saving a file, atom adds a new line character at the end of a file.
Is it issue or a feature?
Ubuntu 14.04. Atom 0.134.0.

data.title: tab length restriction
data.body:
In Atom version 0.135, tabLength variable is restricted to one of these five numbers -- 1,2,4,6,8.

discussion: https://discuss.atom.io/t/why-restrict-tab-length/12458
commit: https://github.com/atom/atom/commit/7f5428e2a460641700bcff992e62026fe939dd5f

data.title: Mac Services
data.body:
Seems like later version of Atom (.130+) have enabled the Services menu on OS X; however, I only see two service (see image) and have many installed (see second image). Use many of Terpstra's markdown services, including SearchLink, within other editors, but have not been able to get several to work in Atom. Anyone else experiencing this issue? Current version is .135.

![screen shot 2014-10-05 at 1 12 00 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/665292/4519202/0215b502-4cb3-11e4-9ea0-cdac9469d081.png)

![screen shot 2014-10-05 at 1 15 03 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/665292/4519208/367132d6-4cb3-11e4-9f03-ea66dde1701e.png)

data.title: New line when shifting
data.body:
I am running Atom 0.135.0 with Windows 8 (not 8.1).   When shifting and pressing enter (SHIFT + ENTER) it should start another line, however, it doesn't.  It doesn't show any errors, just doesn't do as hoped.
## 

I'm pretty sure adding this to [this file](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/keymaps/win32.cson)  would resolve the problem:
'shift-enter': 'editor:newline'

data.title: Allow pure custom element pane item views
data.body:
Status: PR ready for merge once we get a green build.

The workspace has already been converted to custom elements, but [`PaneElement::activeItemChanged`](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/pane-element.coffee#L55) still expects all pane item views to have `.__spacePenView` shim properties and attaches, hides, and shows the views with jQuery. This needs to be converted to support raw custom elements that are attached, hidden, and shown via native DOM APIs. Whil doing this, it also still needs to support `afterAttach` and `beforeRemove` lifecycle hooks for any SpacePen wrappers for those elements.

data.title: Toggle-soft-wrap command is broken
data.body: /cc @benogle just because it relates to config.

data.title: Add new editor.tabType scoped setting
data.body:
While digging into scoping `editor.softTabs` in https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/3718, it's pretty clear that the setting has very little influence on the actual value chosen. It's effectively the worst-case fallback: it only works on an empty file.

I propose doing a couple things:
- adding a new `editor.tabType` setting that accepts 3 values: Auto, Hard, Soft. With the default being `auto`. Then in the scoped settings for each language, they can set it to whatever they want. 
- Changing `TextEditor::setSoftTabs` to being a settings override accepting 4 values: unset / use-the-settings, Auto, Hard, Soft
- Reading the settings on each time we need to get the tab type. Something like (pseudo code): 

``` coffee
getTabType: (scopeDescriptor) ->
  @userTabTypeOverride or atom.config.get(scopeDescriptor, 'editor.tabType') or atom.config.get(scopeDescriptor, 'editor.softTabs') or 'soft'
```

See https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/4231d6942101c3e77a1d0371cf3b61045b8fa6fb/src/text-editor.coffee#L93 and https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/4231d6942101c3e77a1d0371cf3b61045b8fa6fb/src/text-editor.coffee#L2319 for reference.

Refs 
- https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/3584 

Comment if you know of more issues, complaints. I know there have been several complaints about this, but cant find issues.

data.title: Add scoped settings to user config
data.body:
Status: Donezo

Building on https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/3674, the plan is to allow for scoped configuration of editor settings. This solves the problem of "I only want to soft wrap in markdown documents", "I need hard tabs for make", "I want 2 space tabs for ruby and 4 space tabs for python", etc. 
### The settings

Here are the settings I plan on scoping:

``` coffee
# Scoping these is obvious to me
editor.softTabs
editor.tabLength
editor.softWrap
editor.softWrapAtPreferredLineLength
editor.showInvisibles
editor.showIndentGuide
editor.nonWordCharacters

# Scoping these seems good, but maybe not
editor.invisibles
editor.autoIndent
editor.normalizeIndentOnPaste
```

Language packages will be able to set these settings in their `scoped-properties` cson files. 

Comment if you have suggestions about settings that should / should not be scoped. 
### User config file format

The user will also be able to override these settings in their config file. The plan right now is to place all the current settings under a `global` key, then any overridden scoped settings under their scope. Check it:

``` coffee
'global':
  'editor':
    'fontSize': 14
    'fontFamily': 'monaco'
    'tabLength': 4
  'core':
    'themes': [
      'atom-light-ui'
      'atom-light-syntax'
    ]
'.source.gfm':
  'softWrap': true
'.source.gfm .code':
  'softWrap': false
'.source.ruby':
  'tabLength': 2
```

In this example, all languages other than ruby will use 4 space tabs, and ruby will use 2. Additionally, markdown files will be wrapped. One neat thing, because of scoping, is that code blocks in markdown will _not_ be wrapped in this case. 
### Backward compatibility

The config file will be read in as it is today. It will check for a `global` key, and if not there assume the old format. Upon writing the file back out, it will write out with global config under the `global` key.
### TODO
- [x] scope editor.tabLength
- [x] scope editor.softWrap
- [x] scope editor.softWrapAtPreferredLineLength
- [x] scope editor.preferredLineLength
- [x] scope editor.scrollPastEnd
- [x] scope editor.showInvisibles
- [x] scope editor.showIndentGuide
- [x] scope editor.nonWordCharacters
- [x] scope editor.invisibles
- [x] scope editor.autoIndent
- [x] scope editor.normalizeIndentOnPaste
- showLineNumbers (punting. Will scope and fix gutter hiding in one unit of work)
- scope editor.softTabs (punting for now. Later: https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/3719)
- [x] read / write new config format
- [x] Merge https://github.com/atom/scoped-property-store/pull/3
### Prior Art

Refs https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/2593, https://github.com/atom/language-make/issues/3, https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/2917
Depends on https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/3697, https://github.com/atom/scoped-property-store/pull/3

data.title: Add a grunt task that publishes directly to Launchpad.
data.body:
- [BuildingASourcePackage](https://help.launchpad.net/Packaging/PPA/BuildingASourcePackage)
- [Uploading](https://help.launchpad.net/Packaging/PPA/Uploading)

Seems like it's a matter of having the right key installed on the right box, and running

```
debuild -S -sa
dput ppa:atomeditor/ppa <filename>.changes
```

Relevant, of course is the [Ubuntu Packaging Guide](http://packaging.ubuntu.com/html/)

data.title: Lua package in the default installation
data.body: What about having a Lua package in the default installation?

data.title: Config gets stuck to default if config.cson has a syntax error
data.body:
I somehow managed to get a syntax error in my config.cson (completely unable to reproduce what caused it now), which caused Atom to fail to parse it, and instead just used defaults.

Thinking I'd managed to delete some config somewhere went and set stuff back to how it was, but nothing was persisted and everything was reset on next restart. I'm guessing this is Atom refusing to overwrite the existing file, though I couldn't see any errors to that effect in the dev tools.

The behaviour of not completely clobbering an invalid config is good but maybe there could be a warning in the UI and/or the invalid config.cson be copied somewhere else so that subsequent changes can be persisted properly.

data.title: Atom fails to Restart and Install Update
data.body:
I've been having this issue for months now where I will be notified of a new version and I can download it but when I hit "Restart and Install Update" ( currently on 0.129 ) it closes and then... nothing. When I reopen I'm still unuqdated and the new version re-downloads.

Could it be Yosemite? GitHub for Mac also fails to auto-update in the same way.

data.title: Saving current session should be in the core and enabled by default
data.body:
I think that Atom should be saving the current session (All open tabs and their contents as well as the tree view) by default. It is important to note that saving the session should be done not only on exit, but every time changes are made to the files (without the user having to save the file) So the work will persist even after Atom crashes.

In Sublime you never have to think about what files are open, if you saved last changes, etc. You also never have to worry what happens to your work after crash, you are guaranteed to have it all intact when you open it again. This is very handy and frees you from thinking about trivial things.

data.title: Add ability to disable folding icons in gutter
data.body: See: https://discuss.atom.io/t/how-do-you-turn-off-folding/12371

data.title: Phabricator arc diff fails when atom is EDITOR
data.body: When doing an arc diff with Atom as EDITOR, the editor opens but upon save + close Phabricator hangs. Switching to a different editor fixed this issue but I'd like to continue using Atom as my go-to editor.

data.title: Doesn't warn if file has been updated.
data.body: Atom will reload a file if no changes have been made but if you make changes and then the file is updated by another person before you save there is no indication that you are about to override someone else changes. This is problematic when working on remote shares where a team can be editing the same file. It would be nice if Atom would prompt you that the file was changed outside of Atom and ask if you would like to reload the file.

data.title: Uncaught ReferenceError: deprecate is not defined
data.body:
Seeing this:

![screenshot 2014-10-02 10 20 07](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4365/4492194/57828d92-4a3f-11e4-99d3-c18b1fc8e900.png)

Whilst editing a Markdown file in Atom Version 0.134.0 (0.134.0) on Mavericks 10.9.5

data.title: Support GitHub Releases changelog in package settings
data.body:
Originated from https://github.com/sindresorhus/atom-fixmyjs/issues/3

> Not sure if Atom supports that, but would be a bit ironic if it doesn't.

data.title: Problem in handling hierarchical .gitignore in the treeview
data.body:
Hi, and first, thank you so much for your project.

This problem first appeared in my work project which is unfortunately private. All my files was considered as ignore and appeared in grey in the treeview. I took some time and finally succeed to isolate and reproduce it.

In a Git project, if a .gitignore from a subdirectory match a path from the root of the project, the treeview will use the rule and ignore the path while it's incorrect. Indeed, Git will not do the same mistake and the `git status` will be different as what Atom show.

You can easily test on this repository I create to demonstrate the problem:
https://github.com/Swiip/atom-git-tree-test
The `test.txt` file inside the src directory should not be displayed grey as it's not ignored in git.

If it's needed, I tested on a Mac with OSX 10.9.5, Atom 0.134.0, I tried several times to delete cached files and it change nothing. I have no error in the developer panel.

data.title: Travis builds are failing
Context Submenus are broken
data.body:
From the docs example at https://atom.io/docs/latest/creating-a-package#context-menu:

``` cson
'context-menu':
  '.workspace':
    'Inspect Element': 'core:inspect'
    'Separator': '-'
    'Text':
      'Select All': 'core:select-all'
      'Another Separator': '-'
      'Deleted Selected Text': 'core:delete'
```

Throws the error: `Uncaught TypeError: undefined is not a function`

data.title: Yosemite Beta 4 bug with formatting
data.body: I am experiencing an issue with the JSFormat package which adds a line break after each word/symbol. This happened right after the Yosemite Beta 4 upgrade. Upgrading the package/atom, reinstalling, etc had no effect. The author of the JSFormat as well as myself think it has something to do with Yosemite itself which may affect Atom as a whole so I am posting it here. Please refer to this issue for the original post: https://github.com/jdc0589/jsformat-atom/issues/31#issuecomment-57574982
